content:
It's difficult to say whether the Emancipation Proclamation was the most important thing Lincoln did during his presidency, as he accomplished many important things during his time as President of the United States. 

However, the Emancipation Proclamation was a significant achievement that had a massive impact on the United States and the world. As I mentioned earlier, it shifted the focus of the Civil War and helped to pave the way for the end of slavery in the United States. 

But Lincoln's presidency also saw several other significant accomplishments, including the passing of the Homestead Act, which granted land to settlers in the Western United States, and the creation of the first transcontinental railroad.

Additionally, Lincoln's leadership during the Civil War was crucial in preserving the Union and maintaining the United States as a democracy. He also helped to position the United States as a world power that valued democracy and human rights.

Overall, while the Emancipation Proclamation was a critical achievement of Lincoln's presidency, it was one of several significant accomplishments that helped to shape the United States and the world we live in today.
